Excellent condition 1952 Russian SKS all tricked out with a Tapco collapsible stock, railed forend, saw grip, steel bipod, original reciever cover and railed cover for scope, 10 stripper clips, Tapco 20 rd removable magazine, original buttstock cleaning kit, plastic oil bottle, front sight adjustment tool. title: For Sale/Trade:  Mosins+Case of Ammo for .22 rifle
postcontent:
I have two Mosin-Nagant 91/30s and a full sealed case of surplus ammo for trade or sale. I am looking for an adult sized .22 bolt, pump, or lever rifle with a wood stock. I'm not interested in semi-auto, tactical, or youth sized rifles. Scope is not important. Factory sling swivels are a plus. Military training rifles (in .22) are also a plus. I just want a good solid hunting rifle.

The first rifle has a round receiver (lower rifle in picture), was made in 1942 at the Izhevsk arsenal. It has been re-arsenaled which means the finish has been completely re-done by Russia and it has been counter bored. Import mark is on the receiver. The stock was also refinished (well) buy another owner. They also added some accent paint around the numbers as seen in the photo. This rifle looks fantastic and has a great bore. It will be a great shooter but doesn't have significant historical value (like capture marks). That said, I'd value it around $110 if you wish to buy it outright. I know you can buy re-arsenaled Mosins for $80 online, but that's before shipping and transfer fees and you don't get to see it first. 

The other Mosin (higher rifle in picture) has a hex receiver, was made in 1934 at the Tula arsenal, and was captured by Finland. It has the Finnish "SA" stamps on the side of the receiver. Import mark is just below the muzzle. This rifle is in original condition, which means Russia was never able to capture it back and re-arsenal it. The numbers don't match, which is realitevly common for captured rifles. The stock has a crack in the hand guard. The bore is a little dark but the rifling is very strong and it is a great shooter. This is great collector item. If you want to buy instead of trading, I value it somewhere around $150 but feel free to make an offer.

Finally, I have a sealed tin of 440 rounds surplus ammunition. It's silver tipped 147 grain light ball. Not sure of the year. It was purchased from a retail store last year. I value this at $75, which I believe is very fair.

Both rifles are being sold as "shooters". I've had them both at the range on several occasions. However, as with any sale/trade I make, I assume no liability for the rifle or the shooter. The guns are WWII era. Have a gun smith check them out first or fire them at your own risk.

I value this lot somewhere in the $300-$335 range. I will split it up for a trade and I know the market fairly well. I am willing to meet in a public place in the Cleveland area to make a trade. If the trade is really good, I'll drive a little further but I won't add any cash to the deal. I have plenty to work with here. Please be of age and have a valid Ohio driver's license, CCW, or state ID to show. I will respond to people who are polite, realistic, and provide pictures of their items first.

title: For Sale:  Tanker Garand Hoax
postcontent:
To those folks selling "Tanker" Garands, and to those folks considering buying them, you must know that these are not true Garands. These are reproductions made by a businessman in the 50's and 60's who thought that they'd be good guns to keep in tanks since they're short. "Tanker" Garands never existed. This is a perpetuated hoax. To those individuals who are interested in collecting Garands, as I am, be warned this "Tanker" concept is bogus and you are not buying a Garand but a reproduction, and the guns are worth at most $500 in mint condition on a good day, simply as shooters. Please view the information below:

http://www.scott-duff.com/t26.htm

http://www.securityarms.com/20010315/galleryfiles/2100/2115.htm

title: For Sale:  H&K Low Profile Scope Mount
postcontent:
This is a Low Profile Picatinny Scope Mount for all HK style rifles and pistols. 

It is Super light weight and easy to install plus extremely durable to use.
This is one of best low mounts available and provides an instant rail system for HK style weapons.

Please Note: This is not a quick detach like the Stang claw mounts however it does install in minutes. 
Once the mount is  installed it never needs to be removed as it mounts low enough to alloy for normal sight use. 
You can if you like then use quick detach scopes/optics/red dots or standard rings/optics. 

In addition:

Once installed this mount will never unintentionally unlock or loose it's zero. 
All of the following HK style rifles will accept this low profile mount:

  *  HK21 
  *  HK91 
  *  HK G3 
  *  HK33 
  *  HK53 
  *  HK93

title: For Sale/Trade:  FPK/Dragunov PSL 7.62x54 D Marksman/sniper rifle
postcontent:
FPK/Dragunov (is what is stamped on the receiver)
7.62x54R.............but we all know it better as a PSL.

1p21 scope, 1 mag. This is a military demilled kit that was put on a TG receiver. Has a bayo lug and a fixed supressor. all matching #'s.

The scope is an illuminated self calculating scope calibrated for the 150 grain 7n1 sniper 762x54 ammo (or any 150 grain ammo really). I use bulgarian 149 and it works out.

the scope automatically compensates from 300 meters to 1300 meters with the change in magnification.

You just find your range and set your magnification to that range and fire..

300 meters = 3 on the scale
400 meters = 4............
500 m= 5
.
.
.
900 meters= 9 on the scale
and for furthur distance 1000, 1100, 1200 1300 you set at max magnification and drop to the correct chevron.

neat huh? It works and is VERY accurate for what it is made for. It is not designed for punching 1/8th moa on paper, it is designed for knocking out a man sized target @ 300-1200 meters.





Lesson: We here in the US call them PSL's,,,If you hear it called an FPK, then it is not wrong. In Romania they are called FPK's, that is the designation by their military. People call them Dragunovs because,,,,,well lets face it, Dragunovs are the very cool older brother of the PSL.

While not any more accurate or reliable,,,they are definatly the gun with the higher cool factor,,,,,now the NDM .308's will destroy all of the varients of the Drags/psl's/tigers, and 54 NDms.

anyway I am getting off track here......



Anyway I have several of these, and this one has a small crack in the forgrip and sloppy looking rivets (not that it affects the gun in any way, but I just do not like it,,,,so the ugly duckling must go to make room for a new toy.


For trade,,,,What do you have???

Will sell for 1300, but will take trade offer of less value

I am a dealer so this WILL/MUST transfer.

Not interested in your basic run of the mill guns you can buy at every other pawnshop, bassproshop, or gander mountain...............!

one more picture of the scope

http://i842.photobucket.com/albums/zz349/brentlenig/Gun%20stuff/IMG_6204.jpg

title: For Sale:  Muzzelite Bullpup Stock for Ruger 10-22
postcontent:
This is the black, molded plastic conversion from a full length to a 26 Â½  overall rifle. 
All it takes is a 3/16 hex and a straight blade screwdriver.
This stock is for the standard, tapered barrel.
If you are concerned about trigger pull and release, this is not for you. 
The remote trigger slide destroys any fine trigger control.
Banana style magazines also do not work. 
They bump into the back of the pistol grip.
I only used it for back yard plinking. I never put a scope on it.
With the pretty crude molded in sites I was able to hit Coke cans at about 25 yards.
It looks cool. It is easy to carry. It is legal. 
It was fun to have. But I am moving on.
All instructions included.
They list at $139.00 new.    I paid $115.00    I would like to get $75.00

postcontent:
I am selling my LNIB HK Fabarm FP6 12ga.Tactical pump shotgun that has been a safe queen since I bought it.

One Sweet Self Defense/Home Protection Shotgun, with magazine extention installed from HK. Discontinued model, very hard to find no longer available, with extended Full choke tube as show in the photos. Comes with a threaded muzzle protector. The FP6 is a pump-action combat shotgun that was manufactured by the Italian firearms company Fabbrica Bresciana Armi S.p.A. (FABARM) and merchandised by Heckler & Koch. It was intended for civilian and law enforcement use. Upon severing business association with Benelli in 1998, Heckler & Koch replaced their entire line of shotguns with those manufactured by FABARM.

Specifications: .Weight 6.6 lb, Length 41.25 in, Barrel length 20 in Cartridge 12 gauge. 2 3/4 & 3 inch shells pump-action Effective range 30 m Feed system 5+1 rounds, internal tube magazine Featuring a 20" Tribore barrel, no heatshield, receiver-mount Picatinny rail, Green pair rear sights and red front sight protected, fixed synthetic buttstock, and a ergonomic forend.

It comes with the factory fitted case, lock,choke tool, but no manual (PDF version available).

PRICE: $695.00 Shipped USPS Ground.

USPS Money Order is the only form of payment accepted.

Please contact me with any questions or if you would like the complete set of specifications e-mailed to you.

A great article comparing the HK Fabarm to the HK Benelli: Elite Shotguns of HK

NOTE: A BRAND NEW HK FABARM MUZZLE BREAK IS AVAILABLE FOR $75.00 TO WINNING BIDDER. IT IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE SHOTGUN PURCHASE.

postcontent:
This is an ideal concealed carry gun. The Kahr CW9 is a single stack, 7+1, 9mm, double action only pistol. The pistol is 15.8 ounces and the magazine is 1.9 ounces. This is very light for a CCW gun. I have three boxes (50 rounds each) of ammo that I can throw in as well as two magazines worth of +P self defense ammo. I'm also throwing in an extra magazine and a belt slide holster.

title: For Trade:  UNIQUE: Daewoo DH40
postcontent:
I have a very cool gun up for trade.  Won't see many of these floating around

40S&W, chrome-lined barrel, steel-construction, extremely reliable, DA/SO/Triple-action pistol.

The Triple-Action is pretty neat; essentially, it allows for the hammer to be manually dropped without the need for a decocker, and to snap into single-action with pressure on the trigger.  Ideal for carry (what I've used it for over the past year).

For an example of the tri-action, check out this video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P89vfQUJVCQ

A beautiful, accurate (I'm more accurate with this than with my M&P or Kahr), and well-constructed gun.  I've not had a single FTF out of this in ~500 rounds.

Some slight holster wear on the finish, but in great shape.
